title: Responsive Design & Media Queries
description: Make your layouts adapt to different screen sizes using media queries and fluid design techniques.

lessons.title: Introduction to Media Queries
lessons.description: Understand the syntax and use cases for CSS media queries to apply styles conditionally based on viewport characteristics.
lessons.task: Write a media query that applies when the viewport is at most 600px wide and changes the background of '.responsive-box' to lightcoral.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: sans-serif; padding: 1rem; } .responsive-box { padding: 1rem; background: lightblue; }

validations.message: Use a media query for max-width: 600px

lessons.title: Fluid Typography
lessons.description: Use relative units like vw to make font sizes scale with the viewport width.
lessons.task: Set the font-size of '.fluid-text' to 5vw so it scales as the viewport changes.

lessons.title: Flexible Grids
lessons.description: Combine CSS Grid with auto-fit or auto-fill for responsive column layouts.
lessons.task: Define '.grid-responsive' with grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(200px, 1fr)); and a gap of 1rem.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: sans-serif; padding: 1rem; } .grid-responsive > div { background: #d1c4e9; padding: 1rem; }

lessons.title: Mobile-First Media Queries
lessons.description: Adopt a mobile-first approach by writing base styles for small screens and enhancing for larger viewports.
lessons.task: Write a media query for min-width 768px that sets '.sidebar' width to 250px.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: sans-serif; padding: 1rem; } .sidebar { background: #c8e6c9; padding: 1rem; }

validations.message: Use a media query for min-width: 768px
